pageTitle: London Underground Service Update - Metronet Strike Suspended - Wednesday, September 5 - 0845hrs

title.title: London Underground Service Update - Metronet Strike Suspended - Wednesday, September 5 - 0845hrs

texts: "We are pleased the RMT has suspended its strike action at Metronet, following the clarification of all jobs and pensions issues.
"We will now work to provide the best possible Tube service on Wednesday.
"However, as the strike was suspended so late last night, it will take time for us to restore a full service on all Underground lines today.
"Passengers should check before they travel to see how Tube services are running. Our staff will be available to provide travel advice and assistance on Wednesday."
The latest service update on all lines can be found at the end of this press release.
Passengers can check before travelling via the following options:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["The TfL \u003ca href=\"http://www.tfl.gov.uk/\"\u003ewebsite\u003c/a\u003e ","The London Travel Info 24hrs telephone helpline: 020 7222 1234","BBC Ceefax, page 436, or ITV's Teletext, page 164","Information on posters at stations and information boards at Tube stations\u003cbr /\u003e"]}
A summary of current service on London Underground follows:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Bakerloo line - services restored with minor delays","Central line  - services restored with severe delays","Circle line - suspended","District line - suspended","East London line - suspended","Hammersmith \u0026 City line - suspended","Jubilee line - good service","Metropolitan line - suspended","Northern line - good service","Piccadilly line - minor delays on the Uxbridge branch","Victoria line - services restored with minor delays","Waterloo \u0026 City line - services restored with minor delays"]}
